snippet: Mayor Sergei S. Sobyanin’s plan to set elections two years early would give opponents less time to mount effective campaigns against him.
abstract: Moscow Mayor Sergei S Sobyanin says he wishes to step down two years before end of his term and hold snap elections on September 8, radically accelerating election cycle in apparent attempt to minimize risk of political change; if Pres Vladimir V Putin accepts Sobyanin's resignation opposition forces will have little time to organize campaign.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Sergei S. Sobyanin’s plan to set elections two years early would give opponents less time to mount effective campaigns against him.

headline.seo: Moscow Mayor to Step Down to Gain Election Edge
headline.main: In Moscow, Mayor’s Move Could Mean Snap Election
headline.print_headline: In Moscow, Mayor’s Move Could Mean Snap Election
